message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SD, cs.SD, cs.SI, cs.LG

Reasoning: 
- cs.CL (Computation and Language): The paper focuses on learning spoken sentence embeddings that capture both acoustic and linguistic content, which falls under the scope of natural language processing (NLP) and speech recognition, both of which are sub-areas of cs.CL.
- cs.SD (Sound): The paper deals with audio data and proposes a method to learn embeddings that capture acoustic content, which falls under the scope of cs.SD (Sound).
- cs.SI (Signal Processing): The paper proposes a method to model speech at the sentence level, which involves signal processing techniques such as feature extraction and reconstruction, which falls under the scope of cs.SI (Signal Processing).
- cs.LG (Machine Learning): The paper proposes an encoder-decoder model for audio-linguistic multitask learning, which involves training a model to simultaneously reconstruct acoustic and natural language features from audio, which falls under the scope of cs.LG (Machine Learning).
- cs.CL (Computation and Language): The paper evaluates the proposed method on speech recognition and emotion recognition tasks, which are sub-areas of NLP and fall under the scope of cs.CL.
